title: Mu�oz Freelance
content:
I�m designing the brand for my freelance work and would like to have some comments from the typophle erudite community.   
   
I�m aiming for the small bussineses of the local market (Celaya and i�ts surrounding towns) with about 600,000 in population with commercial and industrial activity. There are many designers in town working on small studies whose main offer is creativity and price so I intend to sell the "Design by Objectives" positioning. I am willing to do most of the works I get by subcontracting things I�m not good for like illustration and photography, on the future I would like to do more publishing work but there is not much market for it in here.   
   
NAME   
I decided to avoid symbolic names because I want to be directly related to my work so I�m using "Mu�oz" alone, maybe I�ll have to add a label to describe the "Industry" and positioning I�m at as I found really hard to signify Design.   
   
LOGO   
The first thing I made was the type on which I�m willing to connotate power, graphics and contundence so I chose geometric, lineal, abstract, bold and angular. After I chose the bow and arrow as symbols to metaphorize the positioning as if I were an archer with very good aim to hit targets, so I tried different options to integrate this to the name in graphic congruence:   
   
This is the logotype   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121355im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/27519.gif)   
   
This is the only succesful bow, arrow and type integration I achieved   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121355im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/27520.gif)   
   
This is my monogram on a centaur. (Hector Mu�oz Huerta)Can you see it?   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121355im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/27521.gif)   
   
This is the centaur with out letters.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121355im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/27522.gif)   
   
This is the most abstract and symbolic I could get.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121355im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/27523.gif)
author: rs_donsata

comments.content:
Well what do you think of it? Is it too squared? too rigid? I missed to say I intend to show discipline as well (designers have a terrible fame in town)   
   
I have been having serious recognition troubles with all the symbols on the tests ran with my family members.   
   
I haven�t still considered color.
I love the centaur monogramme, and the last one...kinda looks illuminati-ish...really cool.

My favorite:   
The centaur monogram, but i think that could be more friendly, some littles round corners...my opinion
I love the Centaur Monogram. Leave the sharp angles on the monogram and make your name contrast with it implying accessibility.
I think is too agressive...i can see some shark teeth! ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121355im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

The centaur monogram is killer.   
The first two are too hip, just the centaur is boring, and the last one looks too religious.   
   
hhp

Thanks for the comments, my first choice is the monogram centaur as well, but I am doubtful of it�s clarity so I�ll try to give it a tail. I don�t think it�s too aggresive (just enough) but maybe it has some kind of totalitarian "SS" look. I�ll try to counteract this feeling with the graphic layouts and color, maybe some type adjustements.   
   
My second choice is the sole centaur, it�s more static and maybe boring but it�s the clearest, I�ll give it a try with color and type, maybe inclination.   
   
The name on the top will accompany the final choice symbol, that�s why I�m concerned of graphic coherence.   
   
I�ll post the next sketches with colour in a couple of days.
Tiffany, what is inked in skin? tatued or painted ?

You make it look inked in skin by drawing on a semi-transparent substrate and either scan of photograph.   
   
I think that the centre centaur is brill-o! Your intials are there, popping in and out - stick with this one.   
   
kris.

The centaure is on the money. Love the concept. can we define the "arrowhead" from the bow? That might make it a little more insightful.   
   
Cool stuff.
Try thinning the arms to match the calligraphic strokes of the hmh. The eye-head is a little creepy but it's still better than the tangram style.

Ok, so this are the first prototypes. I sketched a couple of the non lettered centaur variations and decided to stick with the monogram centaur.   
   
   
This is the centaur. It is a bit darker than the sketch was. There are two suggested variations of it but I think it still works better plain as it is.   
 ![centauro](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121355im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/28195.gif)   
   
   
This is the type, advice on it is the most wellcome. It looks a little odd and I�m not getting a very good integration between the letters.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121355im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/28196.gif)   
   
   
These are a couple of type and logo integrations, I want the centaur to have lots of space to stand out so I�m favouring the vertical setting.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121355im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/28197.gif)   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121355im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/28198.gif)   
   
   
Finally these are my color choices, the red is pantone 193 coated and the gray blue is pantone 5497 coated. Both of these colors are different enough from the main local design competitors, as far as I know no one uses red, which I think makes a great emphasis but maybe the gray blue could bring more convenient connotations.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121355im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/28199.jpg)

Hi H�ctor,   
   
This is really fun. I have two suggestions for you:   
1. The head/eye. Right now the circle is exactly touching the edge of the eye. This is distracting to me. Try overlapping them a little more.   
2. My preference is the type and icon seperate from each other (play with the proportions one to the other). In this setting I think your spikey capital M is out of place. I think it detracts from the icon, is too tall, and not in keeping with the character of the font. I'd suggest maybe using a slightly taller version of the n and add the extra branch.   
   
Ok, one other minor thing. Try the tilde as a little lightning strike nestled above the n (more like the z).   
   
Very nice indeed.   
Well done.   
   
Randy

Pretty nice! But I would let the centaur do the talking, and the "Mu�oz" be very calm (but still slanted by the same amount - maybe a semiserif font).   
   
hhp

Good work, mate. I notice that the eye looks a lot more defined when the "pupil" is coloured and the stroke is white. It looks much more serious and purposeful. The type isn't doing much for me at the mo, calm it down, like Hrant said.   
   
kris.

I like this very much, good work.   
   
Maybe you should make the tilde a little bit heavier.   
   
regards,   
Jacques

Looks nice!   
(Although now you're a wanted man in Holland. ;-)   
   
hhp

Ohh please help me !!! I messed everything up, including the good post at the beginning of the pile, so I�m going to post it again, and if you couldp move it to the place of the first mistaken post after deleting them it would be very nice.

Thanks for all the input. I forgot to post which was the final result of this work, so this is it:   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121355im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/35050.gif)   
   
For the final logo I took your suggestions and changed the type, after several tests I decided to scan some DTL Nobel glyphs from a magazine and traced them, they worked very well, I like this face very much (hope not to end in jail for doing this).   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121355im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/35051.gif)   
   
This is the card which is silkscreened with polycat on front (a very thick ink layer) and something else on the reverse.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121355im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/35052.gif)   
   
For the text face I chose Quadraat Sans which fortunately I got just on the last minute before my delivery to the print shop. Quadraat Sans fits very well with Nobel (being both from the same designer) and gives my documents a very nice bussiness class look.   
   
I made red silkscreened folders with the reversed application of the logo as well as white cover sheets with the folder�s application in red and I�m looking for some cheap cd cards to put my portfolio in. I�ll be building other applications on the fly but I deffinitively discarded doing a shirt and a pin, maybe I�ll make a mug.

Hector...   
�todav�a necesitas ayuda?   
   
si la necesitas te puedo ayudar. Estoy un poco ocupado, pero no importa.

It took a while for me to come around to the monogram centaur. But it is definately growing on me. I finally saw the shark reference, but this did not put me off.   
   
As for its aggression. I am unsure what it is actually like in Mexico. And I am going to be basing this generalisation on my lack of experiencing the America's. But it seems to me that aggressive imagery is very common, within festivals and celebrations. So I do not see it as an issue.   
   
Great result. I love watching all these evolutions.
Hector, that business card is sharp! Very nice work, especially with the new font. The captive tilde is a nice touch.
